intro: Tarenna pubituba, commonly known as the hairy tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems, giving it its common name. It typically grows in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for botanical studies and conservation efforts.
